website_summaries.verdict: Great multi-line office phone that does not require a PBX system to work. We appreciate this model's potential to expand as the business expands. Phone service is not limited to AT&T, and excellent customer service is available.
pros: Arrives with four lines, and additional lines are possible as needs expand
Three-way conferencing, along with 32 number speed dial, speakerphone and headset
Every button serves a single function, which cuts down on user confusion
cons: Speakerphone may have some quality control issues
There is no hold music, and setting up individual voicemail accounts can be challenging

customer_reviews.title: Second one doesn't work either
customer_reviews.text: Order this phone a couple of months ago. Speakerphone quit working (in spite of unplugging to reset) so returned that unit and ordered another one. Now the second one doesn't work and it's just outside the return window. Over $100 wasted. Called AT&T and they were unhelpful after 45 minutes on hold. Garbage and I do not recommend purchasing this phone.
customer_reviews.author: Georgia Reader

customer_reviews.title: Very reliable phone.  My office has 10 of them and we have used for years.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered 10 of these for a busy claims office. We use 4 lines so we needed a phone that can withstand being used all day everyday. Each line lights up when it is used and blinks when they are on hold. Caller ID is easy to see and the scroll for history is a nice feature. The speaker is loud but having used these phones for years the speaker feature sometimes does not work its the only thing that has ever broke with on the phone.
customer_reviews.author: W. Dietrich

customer_reviews.title: Terrible speakerphone
customer_reviews.text: I bought this phone in hopes to get good speaker phone capabilities for my POTS land line. The speaker itself had good audio quality however the other party can barely hear me, most of the time it is completely silent on the other side. Very disappointed. The speaker would work if you're not trying to talk back like if you're on hold, but a 2-way conversation it not possible. The handset does have good audio quality. Caller ID works. Nice phone in other aspects.
customer_reviews.author: castirondude

customer_reviews.title: 1040 is not for me
customer_reviews.text: For a small business phone I would say this phone sucks! The speakerphone is so bad that customers tell me I am constantly breaking up and not clear. We have four lines in our small business and when swtiching lines we end up dropping the other call. Not the phone to use to promote you as being business savy. Bought two phones and both react the same. I will be searching for a better solution.
customer_reviews.author: Bob@Pleasanton

customer_reviews.title: I have had this phone for 2 years
customer_reviews.text: I had Motorola prior and they just wore out. I do not like this phone. Too hard to learn. Sound quality is not great. 3 way conference is like in the old days...you can't hear the 3rd person. My phones prior were great. Directions are difficult and we had to call several times to AT&T. My Millennial's could not even figure it out. I just ordered a new system.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie

customer_reviews.title: conferencing on this phone is awful-parties can't hear one another ...
customer_reviews.text: conferencing on this phone is awful-parties can't hear one another. Buttons aren't well laid out. I returned this phone. Someone needs to make a functioning quality office phone that can run on copper lines/regular phone lines...
customer_reviews.author: jmg

customer_reviews.title: Worst purchase.. waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I really wish I would’ve read the reviews more carefully before I bought this phone. I use it to work at home but it doesn’t have voicemail and the caller ID doesn’t work. What a waste of $100! I could’ve picked up $40 phone at Walmart instead that included an answering machine and caller ID.. This was a terrible purchase!
customer_reviews.author: anonymous

customer_reviews.title: These phones don't work
customer_reviews.text: I got one of these in July 2019 and had to return it because it didn't work. They sent me another one in August 2019 and it is now October 2019 and this one doesn't work. These guys give you 30 days to return then it's out of there hands. You might as well go to an ATT store and buy one of these for a little more money. I have 4 other of these 1070's that I bought 7 years ago that work great. Don't buy from these guys.
customer_reviews.author: Marge

customer_reviews.title: Lousy speaker phone!!
customer_reviews.text: The phone is relatively user friendly and looks good, however the speaker phones (on all 6 phones I bought) are absolutely terrible. I am actually going to replace all of them this week for another brand. Do not buy if you are planning on using the speaker.
customer_reviews.author: RXL

customer_reviews.title: This would've been great when all caller id features worked
customer_reviews.text: Decent phone. However it is manufactured to automatically put a 1 in front of every caller ID number received. This would of been great when all caller id features from the phone company doesn't do the same. You can not turn that 1 off and the phone company can not adjust their caller information. The result is you receiving every caller ID info reading as 1-1(area code)264-6657. Which in turn makes it so you can't just click a caller ID number on your phone to do an instant call back due to an extra 1 in front. Frustrating to say the least.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin B.

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: Does not have all of the features that are advertised. The settings menu is confusing and difficult to navigate. Auto attendant does not work well, and there is no ringing for a caller waiting to be connected to an extension. You cannot personalize voice messages for each line when hooking this up with lesser models such as the 1070's so you are stuck with their automated messages. Spend the few extra dollars and go with a Grandstream Phone system. You will be much happier.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wrong phone sent
customer_reviews.text: We received the wrong model phone, the model we received is a lesser model with no display for caller ID. This was not discovered right away and the return window was closed. Finally replacing this with the intended phone.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice system for small office note not compatable with prior versions
customer_reviews.text: Not as durable old equipment and newer versions Of at&t equipment not compatable with previous generations of equipment Nice multiline system for small office
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Meet AT&T's newest Time Machine!
customer_reviews.text: AT&T missed the prize on this phone. It is lacking in features that I had on phones 10 years ago. No live dial pad? REALLY??? It also has a HUGE delay when you push one of the "speed" dial buttons. They really should call them "delay" dial buttons. The speakerphone is quite obviously not full duplex. I feel like I have stepped back in time 15 years whenever I use this phone.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Bear

customer_reviews.title: Big mistake
customer_reviews.text: This did not work in our office. It did not say that if you have multiple phones they must all be the same (i.e. all AT&T 1070) in order for this phone to function properly. Hold did not work, could not transfer calls, and when someone was on a line anyone could pick up and listen in on the conversation, start dialing, whatever. Would love to send it back but didn't save the packaging.
customer_reviews.author: MR Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Great, but broke after 6 weeks...
customer_reviews.text: Phone is a little better than average, but the answering machine will only work if the phone is not in use, also the speakerphone is marginal at best, it also ceased to work a month after we got it. The intercom system works well, but you can't have any other phones(different brands) connected to your system or it will not work properly. Since we've only had these 6 weeks, but one is already defective, I am a little apprehensive about long term use. Hopefully (Amazon is promptly replacing the broken one;thanks Amazon) these will work out OK. Use is a doctors office 4-6 hours a day. Medium phone traffic, and light usage.
customer_reviews.author: The Wes Guy

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to hear callers on the other end.
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality on all 4 phones was very low/poor. This made it very difficult to hear the people we called or the people that called in. Conversations we extremely difficult because of this. We replaced an older version, the AT&T 955, with this phone, and hoped this phone system would be at least as good. Currently ordered the V-Tech CM-18445. Hopefully this will be better.
customer_reviews.author: Gencian

customer_reviews.title: Basic and work great
customer_reviews.text: Basic and works great for my store. We have 3 devices for the three main areas of the store and they work perfectly for our small business needs. They were simple to set up too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to set up
customer_reviews.text: Use this in a smaller annex office, with 5 phones. They are difficult to set up, and a lot of the listed features are only opened if you hook up to a complete and very expensive ATT phone system. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Better than the RCA 4 line system
customer_reviews.text: Better than the RCA 4 line system, but make sure you test out ALL features (including intercom, speaker etc) immediately after you receive it. So if you have a defective one you can send it back. There seems to be a serious lack of quality control on electronic items these days. Companies want their devices made as cheaply as possible with quality suffering. My last AT&T phones lasted on average 12 years. I guess time will tell on these.
customer_reviews.author: J. Roseboom

customer_reviews.title: It works flawlessly like the originals
customer_reviews.text: We have had these phones for probably well over 10 years and never a problem. We added a new employee and added a new phone to expand. It works flawlessly like the originals.
customer_reviews.author: jeffrey a thill

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfect right out the box
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 3 of these for our office. Worked perfect right out the box. Easy to program. Have not had any issues with speakerphone as of yet but somewhere on here there is a fix for that (unpluging all and plugging back in). Back to the programming...no need to hire some guy for 2k to program your phones with a box. These are simple, plug into the wall and go to settings and determine the transfer # for each headset. No need for wall splitter either. If you have 2 lines, but 1 slot in wall - you simply use 1 wire from wall to phone.
customer_reviews.author: NC ROSS

customer_reviews.title: Received without issue
customer_reviews.text: Rather difficult to set up for answering calls - long delay after outgoing message! Would have considered a single line phone with answering machine.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa J. Knapp

customer_reviews.title: If I had to recommend any improvements it would be the display screen tilt ...
customer_reviews.text: The phones meet the expectations for a small business. If I had to recommend any improvements it would be the display screen tilt so avoid glare, easier speed dial and easier to flip the back panel to change how the phone sits on the desk. We were able to get it setup but the back panel kept popping off. The other oddity is that it doesn't always disconnect. We hang up and it repeatedly calls back. We ended up putting the calls on hold for a moment to break the cycle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love It. Very professional
customer_reviews.text: Love It. Very professional. Looks and operates like a very expensive corp.type. Clear voice and easy operation ! Like the large, very well illustrated operating manuels. Great job AT&T !

customer_reviews.title: Bought as replacements

customer_reviews.author: Dr. RM

customer_reviews.title: Okay phone if you need to save money
customer_reviews.text: We are a small start-up company and not ready to invest in a phone system. We have purchased 6 of these phones, 4 of them through Amazon at a decent price although still may be overpriced. Overall the phone is okay although sound quality issues, cutting in and out and speaker phone volume can't be adjusted. Handbook isn't really user friendly and we still haven't had time to figure out all the features. These issues are exactly what we read about before purchasing but seems to be common in lower end phones. So this phone is probably about the best you can do if you need multiline at a low cost.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing- find something else!
customer_reviews.text: Very unhappy with these phones- too many issues, including intercoms not working & one phone (I bought 4 thinking they would be good in an office) doesn’t work at all. A great disappointment! Find something else.

customer_reviews.title: So Far So Good

Seems to be scalable if I expand my business and have the need for more staff phones. Couple of niggly items. First, the clarity on the speakerphone is not good, so I find myself having to pick up the handset more often than I prefer. Second, the display screen could be larger and also be adjustable to view at different angles. Other than that...a fine phone for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: The sound quality of the receiver is poor. Almost sounds like an echo
customer_reviews.text: The sound quality of the receiver is poor. Almost sounds like an echo. If I unplug the device it goes away and then comes back on the next call. Really would not recommend this product. But since it's past its return window, I'm stuck with 6 of them.

I would not recommend purchasing this type phone.

customer_reviews.author: L. Nicula

customer_reviews.author: Kristi Morgan

customer_reviews.title: OK Phone

customer_reviews.title: Worst Small Business Phone EVER!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this phone to replace the old 1070 I had that worked flawless. But the past 3 I have received not only had some feature changes but failed to work properly one after 3 monthes and the 6 monthes. Then i got a replacement for the last one that went out also.

customer_reviews.title: These phones are so beautiful but they don't work well

customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 of these phones for our company. They work great, except one of the three has a bum microphone - so it cannot be used on speaker phone because the person on the other end cannot hear. customer_reviews.title: High quality phone. A 3rd party website listed this ...
customer_reviews.text: High quality phone. A 3rd party website listed this phone as compatible with a headset I bought, and they are not compatible. Not the fault of the seller in any way.
customer_reviews.author: Siloam PS

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes hard to hear other end...
customer_reviews.text: This phone overall is a great phone. It is full of great features and very easy to use. I guess my only drawback is that sometimes it's tough to hear the other end. I can talk quietly and the other end won't have trouble hearing me (great microphone), but for some reason, it's sometimes difficult to understand the other person. I decided I will keep the pho e and try to use a headset for convenience. Maybe it will be louder?
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: Good phone for the price paid. AT&T support is good
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for $30 from Amazon Warehouse Deals. Good phone. Its handset was loose contact for some days. Called AT&T, they have sent a replacement immediately. No issues after that. Very pleased with the product for what I have paid. I am sure that I still didnt explore its full features but a good sold landline phone.
customer_reviews.author: Sree

customer_reviews.title: 3 out of 4 were very good; one was a defective dud!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered four phones for my office. Three of the four work very well. The fourth one is defective. By the time I could arrange for a technician to install all of them, the date for returns had passed. I would like to purchase two more of this model, but I shall order them from a different seller because I do not want to be stuck with another lemon.
customer_reviews.author: Josef Arnould, D.C.

customer_reviews.title: Good solid phone for a small office
customer_reviews.text: Good solid phone for a small office. As with any phone in this price range, the speaker phone isn't the greatest, but, it does have a headset jack and for the money, it's a good value. Wall hanging is not an issue, just pop the desk stand off the bottom, slide the handset hook out and reverse it and mount it to any standard modular wall phone jack. It even comes with one short cord to be used for wall mounting. I also like the 9V battery backup for those times when the power goes out, the phone doesn't forget its settings.
customer_reviews.author: Wingman

customer_reviews.title: Very reliable
customer_reviews.text: Our phone system was hit by lightning and rather than spend big money for my small business for another one I went with these and they have work great. The only thing I miss is there is no paging. It has caller ID so we can ignore the spammers.
customer_reviews.author: Robert R

customer_reviews.title: okay phone
customer_reviews.text: The phone worked great for a while. But recently, when I'm calling insurance companies, I need to select a prompt by pressing on a number. It doesn't work and the prompt isn't recognized. It's only been a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Thao Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Complicated to program!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Had to call AT&T to be "walked" through programming a simple outgoing message. This phone has so many features and so many manuals on it's operation and programming, that you'll need to be much more of a "techie" than I am.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great basic phone
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item for a friend and he's perfectly satisfied with it.
customer_reviews.author: James Gensmer

customer_reviews.title: Great with tons of speed dials!

Having a corded phone makes it so he can't lose the phone set either. We put it right next to his favorite chair and he can talk to all us kids without having to fumble around too much.
customer_reviews.author: M Eschen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent 4 line Phone
customer_reviews.text: I have 8 of these phones total and I bought this one once I expanded and needed another. These phones integrate easily and program in just a few minutes. The caller ID, the in house pager and in house calling functions work flawlessly as long as all the phones are on the same lines. Perfect for small businesses with less than 16 stations and do not need a PBX system.

customer_reviews.text: This is our fifth one and they all work well for years and that is why we love them!

customer_reviews.text: Great small business office phone system. We purchased the vmail model and the regular non-voicemail models together. Easy to setup

customer_reviews.title: GOOD PHONE...WISH IT HAD CALLER ID.
customer_reviews.text: The phone is good, however, I wish it would include CALLER ID....other than that it is a good phone for the price. I have two other phones of this kind for my office but they are model 1070 instead of 1040 and when I needed an addtional phone I just ordered it online but didn't realize the model number was different...it's pretty much the same phone but some features are missing...again CALLER ID being the most important one to us.

customer_reviews.title: plus a great deal.
customer_reviews.text: compatible to my other lines. plus a great deal...cheaper then Staples

customer_reviews.title: Not worth $1
customer_reviews.text: Speaker is poor quality; person on other line can't hear you at all. Stops working intermittently- won't dial out. Have to unplug it for a while til it resets itself. Does not make my life at the office easier!
customer_reviews.author: Tanya P.

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: This phone, when working, works great. Unfortunately, after 6 months the phone no longer works. I do not use the phone in my office often so it is not due to overuse.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn M.

customer_reviews.title: Phone lines did not connect.
customer_reviews.text: The lines did not connect correctly, lose dial tone when going to another line, hand set didn’t work properly, dial tone button keep getting stuck. Tried to work with it but a month later had to get another phone and couldn’t return after 30 days.

customer_reviews.title: Decent phone for people who still use landlines and a small business
customer_reviews.text: This phone has enough features that it's necessary to read the manual to figure out all of them. It has a speakerphone and you can use a headset to have hands-free phone usage. It has voice mail, 32 speed dial buttons, and allows conference calls. In short, it's a decent phone for those who still use landlines for personal use, or for a phone for a small business.
customer_reviews.author: Kate McMurryTop Contributor: Health & Wellness

customer_reviews.title: Worth the purchase
customer_reviews.text: Great phone. So far no problem with the speaker blowing out as many others reported, however I use a headset most of the time. One of the features that was important to me was setting different ring tones for the different phone lines so I can tell which line is ringing... nice feature. The only issue I have found is the caller id does not always come up, sometimes I just get an error code, the other phones never did that, but it is connected to an Ooma Telo unit which is VoIP. Jon
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: I'm pleased with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: I'm pleased with this purchase. It was the only one I found with (almost) all the features I wanted: mute, records a full hour of messages. I didn't need 4 lines, but there was no lesser-line version with the same features. Also no conference calling.
customer_reviews.author: Veriflan

customer_reviews.title: Not As Advertised
customer_reviews.text: This phone was purchased for a small phone. The speaker is non functioning. It occasionally fails to hang up. Definitely not worth the $100 spent and seems to be no way to return the phone!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jxn

customer_reviews.title: Great 4 line phones
customer_reviews.text: After reviewing different 4 line phones for a customer, I purchased 4 phone for them and they work great. The other choices appeared to have problems according to the reviews. These phones are being used in an office and work perfectly. I can recommend them to anybody.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Pollum

customer_reviews.title: Good phone system
customer_reviews.text: The phones integrate quite well. We've been using them for almost two years now and haven't had any issues. Overall a pretty good all around system. Only thing that really bothers me is the display especially in light and from certain angles. Can be annoying so knocked off a star there and also cause the mailbox interface could be designed better.
customer_reviews.author: Gaazmon

customer_reviews.title: No Support
customer_reviews.text: One of four phones was broken, buttons were sticky, hold button did not work, it would hang up on caller rather than put on hold. Amazon only warrants product for 30 days and Gemini Kalaidoscope, which is the real retailer if you click their little link, does not take care of their products. customer_reviews.text: Everything seems to work fine except the speaker phone option. The folks I talk to have trouble hearing me and say it sounds like I am in a tunnel.

product_meta.title: AT&T 1070 4-Line Expandable Corded Phone System with Caller ID/Call Waiting and Speakerphone, 1 Handset, Black/Silver
product_meta.description:
Style:Speakerphone/Caller IDAT&T 4 line speaker phone caller ID,call wait

AMAZON.COM
The AT&T 1070 Corded Speakerphone is perfect for businesses that need a Speakerphone that supports four lines. The phone is DSL compatible and has a three-party conferencing feature that lets you conduct business with three people together on three different lines. Each line has its own light indicator, and can be set with a different ring tones for easy distinction of incoming calls. Automatic line selection means that when the phone is ringing and you pick up, you will be connected to the one that is ringing. 

As your company grows, the phone system can be expanded to 16 stations with AT&T models 1040, 1080, and 1080. The phone allows you to page, intercom, and transfer calls between stations. A large display provides easy-to-read text for setup and caller information. The phone has a 200-entry memory and a 200-name-and-number caller ID history. Numbers stored in the caller ID history can be dialed directly; and with call waiting-capable caller ID, you can see who is calling even when you are already on the line. If you subscribe to a voicemail service, a red light blinks when you have voicemail waiting. The phone has 32 speed dial and 16 intercom number locations for one-button access to your most frequently called numbers. Memory loss protection prevents the phone from losing its saved data. For hands-free operation, the 2.5-millimeter jacks lets you connect a headset.
